Reviews.Title: “I used to love this hotel, now I'm not so sure”
Reviews.Author: newlyvee
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney every few weeks for work and always stay at this hotel. I love its location (close to great cafes, supermarkets and Kings Cross station). The rooms are small, but functional and well appointed. But I have noticed a considerable decline in the level of service and attention to detail over the past few months. For example, the rooms (supposed to be cleaned daily) are sporadically serviced... bins not emptied, vacuuming not done, toiletries not replaced. On my last stay, it took three days for the microwave in the room to be repaired. I had bought food to cook in the microwave and ended up having to throw it out as well as buy dinner out. I've found the staff to be fairly unhelpful when I raise issues of concern. With all that said, I'm hoping it's a passing phase because I really do like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fast losing its sparkle”
Reviews.Author: Dees_Travel_Tales
Reviews.Content: The Storrier used to be a chic, if compact, option for boutique hotel lover. It ticked all the boxes of the discerning traveller, polished and professional staff, sleek lines and snappy service. Not to mention a stylish little ground floor restaurant and bar, kitted out with transparent Philippe Starck Louis Ghost Chairs. Not anymore. The chairs are stacked up in a luggage room near reception. That used to be the bar. Under the management of the Quest group, the hotel is fast losing its sparkle. The tidy flip-top Brabantia stainless bins have been replaced with super-sized large plastic ones you can't hide anywhere, and the crockery, cutlery and glassware is mis-match of leftovers more fitting in a college sharehouse. The exclusive balcony I paid extra for was frequented by late night revellers who left empty beer bottles and full ashtrays as a calling card. I moved the outdoor table and the leg fell off, seriously. I was informed rooms aren't serviced on public holidays. Well, people travel on public holidays and generally want a clean towel. Unfortunately, the location is great, which makes it a good choice... but sadly the management are running this place into the ground. Go now because at this rate it will probably be converted to a dormitory in six months.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good room, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LibbyDarwin
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in Sydney for many years and the location was perfect. It's very close to Kings Cross Station but surprising quiet at night, even in the wee hours with the windows open.Close to Centennial Park, the Cross and walking distance to great shopping in areas like Surry Hills and Potts Point. Iris, I agree that hotels at this price should offer free WIFI. But I say to you, Sydney has cockroaches. Coming from Darwin I know it's not a question of cleanliness, you can't completely eradicate them. As to the location, Kate, do your homework before you book. We found the staff extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Daveo_2012
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in Kings Cross, then this is a great location. As others have said, the rooms are small and the parking expensive. We had a 'superior' room which had a small kitchenette. Compared to our friends standard room it was nicer but the bathroom was narrower and we had one of those tiny sinks you can't wash your face in. Our friends did have a problem with the shower overflowing into the bathroom. The room itself faced a brick wall across a very narrow alley and the hotel itself is difficult to find as it is also down an alley. The hotel itself lacks any charm and apart from a quick drink on the roof top terrace (which is quite nice), it is not a place you would want to spend any time. The parking is nearby but not part of the hotel and I wouldn't want to be walking between the two late at night. We were also charged $36 for mini bar after we left and are having a hassle trying to sort this out - email responses promised but not sent to us etc. This is still currently outstanding. With the inclusion of parking, I wouldn't say this was good value and, unless you particularly want to stay in the Cross, I would stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and Arrogant Manager - humiliating experience NOT going back”
Reviews.Author: Iris L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from the 29th to the 31st of March. I was in Sydney for a mix of business and pleasure. I was pretty excited about this hotel as the location is superb, the concept is modern, and it has a gorgeous view from the roof top terrace. Also, the staff seem young and friendly. Upon my arrival I was offered to borrow a car from a friend to use during my visit in Sydney. I asked the girl in the reception if the room came with complimentary parking. She wasn't sure and asked the manager who said I was lucky as there was just one space left and handed me the access card for the parking area. I was thrilled and considered it my lucky day. I continued checking in and got my room. I was pretty disappointed with getting a room in the ground floor but brushed it of and focused on enjoying the vibrant location and atmosphere. The room itself was clean and neat. It was a bit of a disappointment that they do not offer complimentary wifi (this is 2012 step up your game). Also, they were not very flexible with late check for some reason. My main complaint is in regards to my check out. As I was about to check out the girl hands me a bill for the parking of $80 (for two nights)!! I was completely stunned as I was under the impression that parking was complimentary, and I asked them specifically when I arrived. The girl got confused and confused and called the manager who happened to be the same guy who handed me the card the day I arrived. Well he suddenly wasn't as friendly any more. Matter of fact he was rude and obnoxious and basically called me a liar in front of his staff and other guests in the reception, claiming that if he was the one giving me the access card he would OBVIOUSLY have informed me about the price. I tried to explain to him that if I had known the cost I would have taken the access card as I could have managed just fine without borrowing the car. However, I stopped arguing with him as he was just making me too uncomfortable and honestly just wanted to get out of there. He charged $40 and I corrected him and said I was there for two night and paid him the $80. Now why would I correct him and paid the full amount if I was such a liar? Pretty humiliating experience. I don't know if they get a lot of dodgy guests trying to scam them but I certainly do not appreciate being spoken to like that, I am certainly not a dishonest person, and I do not like paying for services I did not agree on. I had a wonderful stay in Sydney and enjoyed the city but instead of leaving with a smile I left feeling humiliated and $80 poorer!!

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dee Y
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this accommodation is the central location to Potts Point, Kings Cross (not as dodgy as it used to be) and Darlinghurst with all the cafes and village-type atmosphere away from the sterile CBD. The CBD is only a 10-15min walk down the hill. The rooms are quite cosy. We had an apartment, with a kitchenette, which was the main reason for booking it. However, there are such good delicatessens, cafes and markets close by we did not need a kitchen. Check out this weblog for things to do around this area: www.sydney-jono.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Quest Potts Point - in the Heart of Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: Big_Stevie_G
Reviews.Content: In some other reviews I have seen there is much said about the location of this hotel. All I can say is, to get there u get off at Kings Cross and the hotel is accessed by an alley which lies between two entrances to Kings Cross Station. But it's a handy location with bars close by and and perhaps a few strip clubs and adult shops will be to your liking. There is plenty of food to be had in the area too and a very good fresh fruit and meat market diagonally across the alley/street from thhe hotel. The hotel itself was very clean and well presented. We stayed in room 234 on the second floor. Our original room was in the basement which was very nice except for the fact the bathroom sink was almost directly on top of the toilet giving anyone over 5 feet in height and 15 stone in weight a bit of a challenge when using the facilities. Staff were very helpful in moving us when this little problem was brought to their attention. Room 234 was at front of hotel but we didn't hear too much of the screaming and cheering out on the street with the window closed. Air con was great, fridge and small kitchenette very handy, lovely comfortable bed. Only problem in the room is the floor of the en-suite gets a bit slippy after a shower with care to be taken not to be doing summersaults. We sat out on the roof garden one of the evenings and had a pleasant view of Sydney whilst tucking into a take-away. Over all happy with this hotel, reasonably priced, convienant to train station but we chose to walk into city centre, the red tourist bus also comes up the main road close to hotel which was very useful. Hope you enjoy your stay there too.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy”
Reviews.Author: Jono J
Reviews.Content: Convenient to lots of services in Potts Point with a supermarket just across the road. Some of the rooms are very small, so depending what your criteria is check with the Hotel when booking. They do have larger rooms and some with city views. The rooms are modern with excellent kitchen facilities. If you like, check out my blog on what to do in Sydney over 7 days on www.sydney-jono.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyStans
Reviews.Content: We chose this property because of its central location and "art deco" character. Accommodation in Sydney is expensive, but for me this really did not represent value for money. Average nightly rate (we stayed 4 nights) was around Â£170 for a distinctly average room. Here's what you need to know: the rooms are small, the bathroom is TINY with a miniscule sink that my husband struggled to use for shaving. The kitchenette counter area is ok, but don't expect to be able to cook comfortably. We just about managed a cooked breakfast. The standard of cleaning is poor: dusty surfaces, a stain on the quilt (which incidentally is not covered by a quilt cover, but by a strange arrangement of folded sheets), and basin not cleaned in the daily servicing. Oh and a dead cockroach in one of the drawers, though they are apparently very common in Sydney and at least it was dead! We mentioned this on departure and were asked why we hadn't complained before. Fair point - but as the reception is not open 24 hours, this had some practical difficulties for us and it wasn't so severe that we wanted to plan our schedule around lodging a complaint. We were assured that the manager would be notified and would follow up with us, but this hasn't happened and we checked out about 10 days ago. To me, this felt like an Â£80 per night property, not one with a Â£170+ price tag. Redeeming features are proximity to the Botanical Gardens and Opera House, and easy access to a station. For the location, it is actually surprisingly quiet as it is down a side street. That is provided the air con doesn't start a strange knocking/ticking sound as it did on our second night, which we eventually solved by removing the key card from the electric slot by the door. Result: peace at last but no aircon. Nightlife in the area is, er, colourful.

Reviews.Title: “Just too small”
Reviews.Author: ElsieWollongong
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in a petite suite. One side of the queen sized bed was up against the wall making access to it a bit tricky. There was very little room to store two people's luggage. We used the iron and ironing board but with this erected in the only available space, it was very difficult moving between the kitchen sink and the ironing board. Similarly, there was nowhere to place toiletries in the bathroom, it also being pretty small. While the bedroom itself was clean, the bathroom could do with a srub or a refit because the shower tiling especially at the join between floor and walls was grubby. It took a long while before the shower water became hot ( what a waste of water!). Because of the awkward shape of the room, the airconditioner blows more of the cool air to the window side of the bed and too little to the wall side of the bed. So, my huband froze while I was too hot for much of the night. This probably suggests that that the room is really for one rather than two people. I suggest that the room not be marketed as an apartment and thus get rid of the kitchen bench. The room would then still be 'petite' but at least there would be room to store luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Colonies
Reviews.Content: Not much to add from other positive reviews. This is great value for the area â€“ and for both work related or holiday travel this is a great location. Itâ€™s close to the train station (about 200m), across the road from the green grocer Harris Farms (so you will have use for the fridge and kitchenette in your room) and so close to some of Sydneyâ€™s better and more fun restaurants. Yes the rooms are small, but perfectly formed. For one person you could easily stay there a few days. Service pleasant and efficient. And did I mention the kitchenette?

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully decorated and great rooms! Location is very near the cross though”
Reviews.Author: crashing_starz
Reviews.Content: Great staff, lovely rooms which include a stove/fridge/microwave/kettle/toaster. Very nicely decorated. It's only a couple of minutes to kings cross station which is convenient provided you don't mind being right near the cross.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was disappointing due to the incredibly small rooms and bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: lwass7
Reviews.Content: Thought the hotel decor was nice and clean for the most part, the rooms were insanely small. We had a "superior suite" which was so small that my husband and I could barely move about the room without tripping over the bed. The bathroom isn't really even separate from the room. It is merely sectioned off by two smoked glass panels. The shower is just the same level as the bathroom floor, merely separated by a curtain, which causes the shower water to flood the entire bathroom. We had a large cockroach come up through the drain on night 1. That was gross, though maybe not uncommon in Sydney. I felt that though the location was excellent and the place was moderately clean and well decorated- the value was poor. $180/night should get you much farther.

Reviews.Title: “Central location in Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: epaki
Reviews.Content: Great location with a nice roof top terrace giving views of the city. The rooms were a fair size, however would suggest that you ask for a room backing away from Kings Cross (to avoid street noise). Also be aware that parking will add another AUD $40 to the nightly price as the car park is in another hotel 1 1/2 blocks away. This can cause a bit of an issue when loading and unloading baggage etc, however if you don't have a car then you won't have to worry about it. The Kings Cross train station is only 30m from the hotel, while Kings Cross provides plenty of human entertainment should you wish to venture out at night. Another tip is to avoid paying for Internet access at the hotel, as you can find free internet at various bars and cafes on Darlinghurst Road (eg. McDonalds). Getting into the city is easy (either walk or catch the train) while you can also take a lesirualy walk down to Woolloomoloo wharf, the Domain and Botanic Gardens and the Sydney Opera House all in walking distance (10-20 mins).

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: Awesome_MacAwesome
Reviews.Content: As a monthly visitor to Sydney, I really enjoy the eclectic nature of Potts Point with it's wonderful food, coffee and atmosphere. Normally I stay with devere but have tried out Quest a few times now. In general, the reviews here are spot on. Staff are not all that friendly and rooms are small; basement rooms are dank...avoid at all costs. Whilst the rooms are tastefully appointed, it doesn't really compensate for the poor cleanliness and cramped conditions. I would recommend Devere or Holiday in which are in the same vicinity and price range. Please do enjoy your trip...it is a wonderful part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, with few really small glitches.”
Reviews.Author: Jhbcub
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in a petit studio. And yes, its PETIT ( small). For 2 people with some luggage it can be cramped. Its not a room you would like to stay all day inn, but its perfect for sleeping. Nice bed, nice tv. Very well equipped kitchenette. Bathroom is small. just for one person. So if you expect large spacious rooms , go for bigger one, this studio is small. Nevertheless its very comfortable and cosy. Very clean and modern looking. Its very close to Tube station, and plenty plenty of bars in the area. I found the area very lively but never felt in any danger . One thing i didnt like is lack of free wifi- and charges are steep ( 50 aud for 3 days). But there is McDonald literally one minute away, and they have free public wifi. Staff is very helpful and efficient. You can also walk to Sydney opera house in 20 minutes ( through an amazing botanical garden). I stayed there on my own, so the room was more than enough for me. But if you are a couple, it can be a bit tight, but nothing REALLY major. I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A mistake I will not repeat”
Reviews.Author: AsiaLad
Reviews.Content: I have friends who have just moved to Potts Point and on a weekend trip to visit them I booked a Petite Studio (PET) at Quest Potts Point primarily because the hotel is two doors down from their apartment, but also because the overall reviews for the hotel were not bad. I booked through the hotel's website but after having stayed there I think that it was not good value for money, particularly considering that there was no breakfast or WiFi included in the rate. As far as I can tell, the location is all that this property has going for it. You're bang in the middle of the red light district, but still tucked away a bit. The King's Cross subway station is a brief stroll away and there is a taxi stand located very close by as well. I checked in at 10:30 PM and I chalked up their lack of enthusiasm to the late hour. I was told that I had been upgraded and was given Room 106. Great! Until the elevator started to move DOWN from reception. Yes, it was a dreaded basement room. And here I thought that my backpacking days were behind me. At this point I'd like to mention that I only gave this hotel a 3/5 rating instead of a 2/5 because I did not bring up any of my problems with the management like I might normally have. This is because I was on a tight schedule and knew that I wasn't going to spend a lot of time at the hotel (for example I checked in at 10:30 PM and was back out by 10:45 PM. So I am giving the management the benefit of the doubt. The room was fair enough, for a basement affair. It was quite spacious and there were a lot of mirrors too. The 'upgraded' room included a miniscule outdoor patio that was completely unusable unless you were a compulsive smoker. There was a couch in one nook next to a kitchenette, and a TV suspended along one wall. The carpet felt a bit dirty. But the worst part by far was the bathroom. Another reviewer initially mistook the bathroom for the closet, and that is exactly right. It looked like an ad-hoc affair that was coming apart at the seams. The Thumbelina sink was nigh on impossible to use and the shower curtain did nothing to keep the water from spraying everywhere. Thankfully, the shower door was slightly raised, otherwise I'm sure the room would have been flooded. Worse yet, the bathroom did not seem clean. There were stains everywhere and it really did look like bits and pieces were about to come apart, particularly from the ceiling and the corners. There was barely room to turn around in there, and I'm a slight-built Asian guy - I can't imagine how a bulkier person would have fared in there. Finally, their check-out time is 10 AM, which is ridiculously early, particularly on a Sunday. I asked for noon but the best that they would give me was 11 AM. I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere !”
Reviews.Author: samelainer
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife stayed at this Quest , on the basis of the quality of other Quest Apartments we have stayed in . What a mistake . The Apartments are located in the middle of Kings Cross, if we had realised we would'nt have booked in the first place . We stayed for seven nights, from 24th Sept 2011. I think they realise many won't want stay once they have experienced the place . Firstly, the address is misleading the apartments are one street back form the Kings Cross main thoroughfare you're actually in the middle of Kings Cross , surrounded by druggies, prostitutes , drunks , its pretty much 247 no quiet or peace, and unsettling in the evening if you wish to go out for a meal / drink . I rang reception to complain as there was alot noise from people staying at the apartments. The original apartment we had booked was a deluxe , I objected as it was so small you had to go outside to change your mind , the next apartment was better but considering how much it cost wasn't value for money . As previously stated by others the bathroom is very small / wash basin useless / impractical , floor would get soaked by overflow from the shower . I paid a security deposit , still not sure what the situation is, I have rang twice regarding credit back ? The staff were pleasant, but we think there's not alot they can do ,the problem is the location and size of the apartments . We're pretty sure Paul Constantinou, Spencer Bailey , Mark Rondo and David Atatagi would'nt wish to spend their precious down time staying in this Quest . Poor value , miniscule size apartments in a bad location , go somewhere else , preferably not in Kings Cross at all .We would have left early but the booking was non refundable . Now we know why !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Appartments”
Reviews.Author: MTW300474
Reviews.Content: In the center of Kings Cross (red light district) a very nice, well kept appartment hotel with a wonderful view from the terrasse on the 4th floor Rooms are very nice, air is a bit humid and the price is quite hi, but for Sydney normal Reception takes care of everything you need

Reviews.Title: “look elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverWomble
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival early in the morning very tired we were grateful to be upgraded to an executive studio from the delux that we had reserved as it was not ready. The room was spacious and well layed out until we looked for the bathroom. It was hidden behind what would normally have been a closet! It measured 3 feet wide by 8 feet long and contained the toilet/hand basin and shower! We could not believe it. The floor was all tiled so that when you shower the floor is flooded and the shower drain is only 3 feet from the toilet. The hand basin is so small that I could barely place one hand in it at a time. I do have photo's but for some reason tripadvisor has a problem and won't upload them. If you would like to see them please ask and I will mail them to you.We paid for the continental breakfast only to be told upon inquiring that the breakfast room was being redecorated and that the box in your room is it....a box with cereal/fruit bowl and milk and a cookie( that is awful). I later asked the new front desk person about the breakfast room closure and was told it was closed permanently. I hate being lied to!!! We had planned to spend 3 nights here now and another 10 nights after our trip to the Cook Islands. At that point I walked down the street to the Holiday Inn and booked there for our remaining 10 nights in Sydney after our a trip to the Cook Islands and cancelled at Quest. Rather than move as we were tired we stayed the 3 nights and had a good couple of good night sleeps as the bed was decent....but as other travellers have stated, it is a very noisy location and without earplugs you won't get much sleep. In our opinion this place is going downhill.

Reviews.Title: “A bad example”
Reviews.Author: stesmi99
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel that makes you feel welcome in this fantastic location, you've come to the wrong place. This is a bad example of a hotel whose management seem to only care about money and treat their guests as just another number. The hotel management was extremely unprofessional, disorganised and the room was noisy and not very clean. Won't be going back. They took 5 days to return my 'security' deposit and almost wouldn't let me check in. They have a zero returns room cancellation policy also. These guys have it all wrong wrong wrong. Someone else was also complaining in reception when I was there about the guests washing being dried on the rooftop. I hope more people read this review and something can be about this hotel to prevent future guests' disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, very reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: esthercharlotte
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four weeks for work. I found the staff to be friendly, professional and unobtrusive. My room was small, but was cleaned thoroughly every day. The TV had some kind of technical problem though - occasionally one of the channels would just freeze. The neighbourhood is King's Cross so you need to be prepared that there will be strippers, junkies, loud music etc in the general vicinity - but the hotel itself in in a reasonably quiet lane about 100m walk from the main drag. The location is great in terms of public transport - the back entrance to King's Cross Station is a minute's walk away. Ironically, I had a lot of noise while I stayed, not from the bars and pubs, but from an incredibly annoying pigeon that started up at 6am every day. When I switched from my original room on the north side of the hotel to a room on the south side, the noise went away. So keep that in mind if you are not keen on pigeons.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Unprofessional Management”
Reviews.Author: Aklaf
Reviews.Content: Currently sitting in our room that we were upgraded to and given an extra night for free, we were extremely happy with the news and thanked the manager on arrival. Unfortunately this morning we were told by another employee that we needed to check-out, we politely explained our situation which he refuses to believe, and conveniently the manager is uncontactable at this time. After lengthy discussion he refuses to budge, claiming that he now did get in touch with the manager and as a company they would never give away a free night (is this not what an upgrade entails?) and that we have 20 mins to leave, after spending 3 nights in our room it is understandable that this is not sufficient time to properly clean and leave the room in a respectful manner. Obviously they have made a mistake on their end and refuse to acknowledge that fact, I have travelled all over the world and have never been treated in such an unprofessional and unkindly manner, and did not expect to get this treatment in my own country. I was recommended this hotel from a trusty advisor but unfortunately will never be able to do the same, I will never stay here or any Quest accommodation in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Poor poor service”
Reviews.Author: AkGop
Reviews.Content: Staved there alst weekend and while most things were reasonably ok (ignoring the multiple strya hairs in our 'clean' bed and the stained pillowcases) the service we have recieved subsequently has been really poor. We left a book in the room and called staff to ask them to post it to us. This was a day after we checked out - almost a week later and still no response as staff couldn't get thru to the room-service workres (which i find rather odd) for the entire week. OK for price and location but wouldn't go back based on the poor customer service subsequent to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home-style comfort in Potts Point”
Reviews.Author: Mike F
Reviews.Content: Upgraded automatically on registration into a bright and airey room overlooking Springfield Av my 5 day business stay was made incredibly comfortable by good staff and practical facilities. This hotel had unique class - for $125 (so cheap for Sydney) a night I had a very comfortable room, iPod dock, flat screen as well as a gas hob and larger fridge. While the adjacent bistro had closed room service was available and in any case there were any number of good restaurants and coffee places close by. Although part of the Quest chain this hotel nevertheless retained its independence and real focus on customer service. No issue was any trouble - cheap internet connection (a rip off in too many hotels in Australia) at $19 a day. I actually didn't mind the continental breakfast packs provided a $10. I'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: NoMoreBunking
Reviews.Content: Wasn't sure what to expect from just another chain hotel, but this quirky little place is wonderful and has that boutique feel. Well located just off Kings Cross in a gourmet corner (upmarket grocer across the road, smart little bistro next door) I don't think I could have chosen better... a fact supported by the number of friends I later discovered also regularly stay here. Check-in was a breeze and very friendly. I'd arrived early and not fussed that my room wasn't ready yet - however since I was going to be having lunch next door, the receptionist kindly offered to take my mobile number and call me as soon as the room was ready (which was actually earlier than expected). I was in the petite suite which is, yes, small but perfectly adequate for one person staying a couple of nights. I didn't use the cook-top, but the microwave came in handy. The room itself was spotless and seemed fairly recently re-decorated. The tiny bathroom likewise. There is not a lot of shelf space in the bathroom or workspace anywhere in the room. My room was quite, the bed was very comfortable, the tv worked, the hot water was hot (tho took a while to get there) and service was excellent. On a sunny day, head to the rooftop terrace for serene views towards the city. There are oversized reading lounges and some outdoor tables and chairs to enjoy a glass of wine and a chat. Highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the middle of Kings Cross Storm”
Reviews.Author: pavlob
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a hotel that is reasonably priced (i paid $94 a night mid-week) in a large city is tricky. But this one is perfect in many ways. Location is incredibly central (close to city and public transport) in the middle of the Cross, yet it's tucked away in Springfield Ave and was really quiet and secluded-feeling. I was in a small studio which was well equipped, clean and actually felt roomy considering it was one of the smaller rooms. Only negative was a bit tricky shaving in terms of where the basin was located in the bathroom...and the TV was a bit out of sorts...and the pillows weren't great. Small things that don't really impact on your stay too much, so dont be put off by it!

Reviews.Title: “Good location.......bring ear plugs!”
Reviews.Author: Topbunk
Reviews.Content: Nice and close to Kings Cross station and great cafes and restaurants. The room we had was good but quite small. The sink in the bathroom was similar to Ken and Barbies. Would have been happy to give up the sink altogether for some double glazed windows. Wasn't even the clubs close by but people in units that back onto the rooms, they might as well been trying to get a drink out of our sink, it was like the door was open and they were in the next room. They had fun though, for the whole night in fact till probably 5am. Other than that a great location and really enjoyed staying in Potts Point. Great base for Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Lea-Anne M
Reviews.Content: I emailed back and forth only days before needing accommodation for a night to go watch a game of footy. So right from the start they were prompt, curious and very helpful. When we arrived nothing was a problem and check in process was very fast, we then went to our room to be very surprised as to how neat and tidy the room was. We chose to stay in one of the small rooms as we were only staying overnight. The room was small but more than adequate. It smelt so clean and had not long been done up as the decor was lovely. The bed was comfortable and room very quiet, didnâ€™t hear a noise. Nothing was a problem the whole time we stayed there. We ate all our meals just around the corner at "The Sugarmill" which is very handy. $10 Steak what more could you want. Will be staying here again real soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price -depends what you want”
Reviews.Author: solstock
Reviews.Content: For the price this property was quite reasonable. It was clean and serviced well each day . The rooms are somewhat crammed but as we didn't intend spending a lot of time in it , this wasn't a big concern to us. There were adeqaute facitities for cooking but you wouldn't want to do much more than the basics. The staff were very friendly and accomodating +

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and new”
Reviews.Author: normystays
Reviews.Content: Neat and new room, nice kitchen unit in room and great night view over the harbour. Small but well layed out with black and white theme. Quiet place in the middle of Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms great but noise from nearby clubs makes it difficult to recommend”
Reviews.Author: tyreke
Reviews.Content: I booked Quest Potts Point to attend a birthday party on a Saturday night, due to the great tripadvisor reviews. Good: The rooms are very clean, nice, modern and moderately sized. No real complaints at all in relation to the hardware. Bad: I arrived back at the hotel at around midnight and from then til approximately 7am in the morning I could hear bass from a night club (day club?) down the road. We called reception but they didn't have an explanation... I don't think there's much they can do about it. Therefore I found it difficult to sleep and probably got 2-3 hours sleep from 12am-8am. I am not a particularly light sleeper and my partner had the same problem. It is a nice hotel but I don't think I could recommend this to anyone where good sleep is priority. I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job nicely”
Reviews.Author: Pointyhead_10
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in little more than an alleyway just off the main drag in Kings Cross, the hotel is perfectly nice. We paid just $119 per night for a two night deal through lastminute and got an Executive Suite in the semi basement (Room 106). Large room, windows that open, your own aircon/heating, kitchenette, sliding doors to a sliver of a courtyard with two chairs and a table. It's stylish, but with few perks.. no one carries you bags, there's no room service and there aren't many staff so they're always busy so don't have time to drop everything do jump to your whim. Which suits us fine. and what did we expect for $119 a night? A few bangs and bashes in place, but not enough to be shabby. Because the room was so hemmed in by tall buildings it was quite dim (suffers from the design trend of having no central light) though you can see the sky so it's not as if it's at the bottom of a narrow, dank lightwell and the shower room is a miracle of miniaturisation (there is only one place to put the towels - on the floor). Was it quiet? Can't say - we were there in the worst rain since 1950, so all we could hear was what sounded like buckets of water being thrown off the roof because the rain was so constant and so torrential that the gutters couldn't cope. I've avoided that area since being kept awake all night (and I mean all night) by roaring backpacker parties, but this time there was no way anyone was outside a second longer than they needed to be. Would I stay there again? I'd give it a go - preferably when it's not raining but would keep my fingers crossed that this didn't bring out the raging backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: daelc80
Reviews.Content: The Quest Potts Point what a great hotel in a great location and the staff where so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of our lives”
Reviews.Author: Re3Le3
Reviews.Content: My partner and I returned to the hotel at around 1am with three friends to eat a pizza, and were stopped at the door by the manager who refused us entry. A friend and I walked past to the room- where the manager followed us, abusing us the entire way. Apparently only 2 people are allowed in a room at one time! Cut a long story short my partner and I were chucked out of the hotel, by the police (!!) left with a pile of luggage in the middle of kings cross. Absolutely horrible experience. The manager was completely and utterly out of line. Even the police thought it was a joke! Do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sydney's Best Kept Hotel Secret...”
Reviews.Author: andyjmac
Reviews.Content: Having revisited my Sydney accommodation options this year I'm delighted to have happened upon Quest Potts Point. Got a little fed up with the diminishing service level at my regular hotel and started to look for something a little different. Must admit I baulked at Quest PP as a first recommendation, unfairly, based purely on the price. I've now become a regular guest, travelling alone, with family and also work colleagues. They were all equally delighted with the experience. Rooms are great, staff could not be more friendly and the location is simply fantastic. I thought parking might be an issue. It's not...the valet service works as though the car has been parked out front the whole time. Colour and movement abounds at your doorstep, yet Quest makes you feel safe and secure at all times of the day. Decor is lovely, everything works, internet charges are reasonable and when I leave things behind (which I do quite regularly) my lost property is always located and held for me. This hotel charges about half what you might expect at a larger, five star establishment, but if like me you are there to work and sleep and don't mind heading out for a swim or massage then it is a far better option.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good for the solo traveller”
Reviews.Author: SimonWise
Reviews.Content: Took a tiny self catering room. Neat but small. Decent self service breakfast. No service as such - basic reception. Hidden behind the main King X drag. Some decent restaurants within walking distance. Would stay again but a bit expensive compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed.”
Reviews.Author: Travel111383
Reviews.Content: I'm currently here on a 6 day/night stay and felt the need to write a review. The petite suite can't really be called a "suite", as it's one small room. For one person it might be ok, but for two on a 6 night stay it's a bit tight. When I called to ask if there might be a larger room available, I was told by the receptionist "it's called petite so the size is self-explanatory." She also would not provide water for the room and told me I had to go to a store across the street. My boyfriend then asked another (very nice) receptionist for water and he brought it up minutes later. When we returned to the room after a day, the cleaners had only made the bed. They did not restock any of our towels or the toiletries and then we had to wait for these to be delivered. So far only on day 2 but a bit disappointed. To be fair the other staff have been friendly and helpful, but a few have so-far ruined the experience.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely come back to Potts Point because of their staff and its stylish establishment!”
Reviews.Author: georgeshkg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Quest Potts Point in Feb 2011. I was planning to stay there for 5 nights but I had to shorten my stay because of health problem. The staff at Potts Point were so caring and helpful. They did their very best to make sure I was OK. I only stayed one night then I had to leave on the following day. Despite my illness, I enjoyed the breakfast and I really like the establishment; it's so stylish and nicely decorated. I will definitely choose Potts Point when I return to Sydney! Georges Poon (Hong Kong)

Reviews.Title: “excellent service but be careful of trackworks”
Reviews.Author: kikoprincess
Reviews.Content: General We really enjoyed our 5 day stay at Quest Potts point. The staff always tried their best to be friendly and helpful. We found it quite safe staying in Kings cross- most of the other visitors we found were also females. Transport We arrived late so no shuttle buses were available. Took the train, it was easy enough- if you travel light. The place was quite easy to find (I had a look at google maps and had a walking gps though). When the trains were working it was really handy- less than 5 minutes and we were out in the city and if we missed the train it was just another 5 minute wait. HOWEVER, we were unfortunate enough to have trackworks on a couple of days of our stay which meant that we had to catch connecting buses. Probably would not recommend you stay there when there are trackworks. Food The breakfast was nothing great, luckily it was included in our price otherwise we would have gone out to the many cafes in the area. Room We stayed in a petite room which was just enough for us. Comfy queen bed, nice pillows. We had a look at the other rooms- huge and decorated very nicely. We had huge problems with the airconditioning at the hotel (and heard that other guests were having the same problem but 42 degree heat, who can blame them) but the staff were very nice and bought us a fan.

Reviews.Title: “Not clean”
Reviews.Author: HongKongErika
Reviews.Content: An average hotel. Not nice to spot pubic hair looking hair on the wall while standing in the shower and I was the first in the family to enter the shower so obviously there from a previous customer. Good location though!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DarwinRules
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have stayed at. As a frequent traveller this is a comfortable and clean hotel with a great team of staff who know the area and sites of Sydney. Am looking forward to a return stay soon.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill... Really fast.”
Reviews.Author: mtcnyc34
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Quest three times. This place used to be clean and had small but very well appointed rooms. It has now become a dirty hole-in-the-wall. It is amazing so see such decline in only a year's time. The carpets are filthy, the walls are scuffed, the bathroom and kitchenette were dirty... Really a sad experience this time around. I love this location for New Year's Eve, but I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing management & poor value”
Reviews.Author: PrincessMaz
Reviews.Content: A poor experience we would not recommend to anyone. We chose Quest to be near to a New Year's Eve party so we could walk home without worrying about the lack of taxis. If it weren't for this location benefit we would have moved out and not suffered the troubled 3 night stay. We should point out that at New Year's peak season all room prices are increased ridiculously and the hotel was full. That meant we were paying US$450 for a moderate sized room in a small hotel with few facilities (no pool, room service, no free wifi). We were initially in a petite suite but swapped rooms with a single friend travelling with us as a petite suite was absurdly small for 2 people and luggage. Most disappointing was management's handling of issues. It was high summer and 30C++ outside and our room had a malfunctioning aircon unit - which staff would not admit. Despite paying US$450 we had to 'sleep' sweating with just a small electric fan on high speed for 2 nights. Staff's initial response was that it was my fault for turning the aircon temp too low (at 17C) so they restarted the aircon claiming that would fix it. The room was like a sauna at this point. We reported it not working again later that day and were told a technician had checked it and reported it was fine. We struggled on with the fan. We were standing in the much cooler hallway and overheard guests in a nearby room with the door open also complaining about the lack of aircon so we know we weren't alone. It was obvious the aircon unit required a re-gas to fix the problem. If management had just admitted the problem, apologised for the discomfort and offered us some recompense starting with a room discount, free breakfast and wifi, we would have been more understanding. Technical issues on a public holiday do happen and can be resolved if you work with guests. Blaming them and hiding the problem to avoid any financial impact has the opposite effect. I was intending to ask for a refund for our remaining prepaid night and mentioned this to a friend travelling with us staying in a similar room at Quest. He reported a problem with his shower to the manager, received a similar arrogant management response and a refund refusal. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Good value.”
Reviews.Author: MRDAV64
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located one street back from the main Kings Cross strip. I had a petitie suite, and yes is was quite petite, but for a solo traveller it was fine. Clean and comfortable and reasonably priced, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Situated 100m from the train station, <10 minutes walk to the Garvan and 20 minutes walk into the city, so all up a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Compact and bijou in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: N5Traveller
Reviews.Content: A very late review - actually stayed Nov 2009! An immaculate small hotel reasonably located for the Sydney sites. Rooms although small were perfectly adequate and had all ameneties required. Very clean and stylishly decorated.Staff were unfailingly helpful. Breakfast bar was fine. Area is "interesting" and may make some guests uncomfortable - just be aware. Nothing far away including transport links. Really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly little hotel-Cozy trendy room-Central location-Affordable”
Reviews.Author: leelewadee
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights and had a great stay. The room & bathroom, although quite small were functional, clean, sleek, modern and pleasant. The bed was very comfortable. The kitchenette practical. We had no problems with noise from the streets (room was opposite side of street) and we only had a minor & resolved issue with the fan in the bathroom. Coming back to the room after a long day around Sydney felt homy. The staff at the front desk not only was helpfull & friendly but seemed happy to be there. Getting a beer at the pub, a kebab, some quesadillas, or a cab was right outside the hotel! (and only a couple of minutes walk for the metro station). We enjoyed the location. Weird crowd and conveniently central.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for a week and it felt like a home from home”
Reviews.Author: OAPSurrey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are in our 60's and we were in Sydney for our son's wedding. I cannot praise the staff highly enough, they were all brilliant. Our room on the 7th floor was a deluxe studio and was all we could have asked for - very clean, bright and spacious with a large wet room and adequate kitchen facilities. We had a very busy week shopping, meeting up with various relatives plus some sightseeing and when we returned we always recevied a warm welcome and solicitous enquires about our day. Recommendations for restaurants were excellent and varied and 'Petrol' next door was great for brunch. We loved the area for its character, choice of eating places and close proximity to transport services, the harbour area and botanical gardens - all within easy walking distance - although I would agree it would not be suitable for families with young children. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone wanting a small, friendly hotel at a reasonable price. J. Boulton Surrey UK

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: minibreakaholic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Quest Potts Point with my partner for a little getaway. We met in Sydney - I flew in, he was already there and we chose this hotel for the valet parking special they had on. We found the hotel difficult to find as the address is not recognised on GPS but we phoned the reception and they gave us directions to the hotel. Check in was great, they upgraded our room to a deluxe, on the bottom floor with a 'balcony'. While the balcony didn't get used (there was only views of the building next door) it was a nice option. The room itself was massive, nicely decked out, the staff are fantastic and extremely helpful. We stayed on a Friday and Saturday night and after reading other reviews thought there might be issues with noise/seedy characters around the hotel. Did not have this problem at all, and because the hotel is one street back from Darlinghurst Road, it was in a quiet little area. The only fault I could find about the entire stay was the size of the bathroom and where it was located. The bathroom is right next to the head of the bed and is tiny. I can deal with a small bathroom but this was by far the smallest I have ever had to use. It was also annoying having the toilet right next to the bedhead - inconvenient waking up the person next to you because you had to go to the bathroom in the middle of the night. Loved it, but not sure I would come back because of the size of the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jabbablue
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a last minute deal website. I didn't realize that Potts Point is virtually Kings Cross. The room we booked was called the Petite Suite. Very very small. The bathroom consisted of an extremely small sink, nowhere to sit your toiletries or clothes. And you had to wait a good 5 minutes before any warm water came through in the shower. The bathroom also floods every time you shower, so don't put your clothes on the floor like I did. No hairdryer. Staff were friendly. I just didn't get good vibes when we ventured out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room in a not so nice area!”
Reviews.Author: Craigbutler1981
Reviews.Content: I was on the 3rd floor at the front of the building. The room was spotlessly clean, smelt a bit of smoke... (noticed a shower cap on the smoke alarm - might want to check that in future between guests checking in!) but as I say... very nice room. The sink and hob/microwave/fridge was a life saver! Bed was incredibly comfortable, I usually have trouble sleeping away from home but I had no problems at all in this room. It's probably a good thing the air conditioning is loud, it blanks out the noise from outside at night.. but it was only really truely noisy outside Thurs/Fri/Sat nights. Service was brilliant - I don't know who the cleaner is but they did my washing up as well, which I was not expecting... got to the door of the room after a long day at work thinking "ahhh crap got to do the washing up" and it wasn't there anymore! A very nice surprise! For the most part the staff were particularly helpful, friendly and chatty... there was one younger guy who barely spoke or acknowledged you, but there's always one isn't there! Would definitely stay there again - and would definitely recommend to people who wouldn't mind cooking their own food to keep expenses down on business trips. Only two real downers being the cost of the wireless internet - it'd be nicer if this was included as part of the costs... also, the "cusine courier" room service system was a bit of a joke. I ordered a pizza and it took an hour and a half to turn up - and the guy had the balls to try and charge me for the "delivery fee" - which was meant to be free if it took over an hour!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Modern Boutique hotel in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: RocketAus
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a petite suite for one night mid week. I travel to Sydney regularly for business and always look around for a good deal. This hotel had a great deal from one of the discount sites, so I thought I'd give it a go. Warmly greeted by very friendly staff and checked in promptly. My room was on the third floor without much of a view - other than a roof of another building. The room was clean, modern and I've stayed in a lot smaller rooms. It is great for a single or a couple. I'm sure the other larger rooms would be good for families. The room had a kitchenette and a small table with 2 chairs. Also had an LCD TV with plenty of channels and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was compact, but very clean with a good range of complimentary amenities. I didn't spend time in the area, but it is central and easy to get to most places. Would happily go back there for the right price and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great friendly and funky small hotel/apartments”
Reviews.Author: hillbillies_5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for our wedding anniversary and was given free upgrade which was much appreciated. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms are quite compact but very functional with modern decor and small ensuite shower rooms. Some of the fittings needed tightening with loose towel rails and taps in the bathroom but all very minor issues. We booked a special that included breakfast that was great value. The hotel is just off kings road and we stayed on friday and saturday night but generally it wasn't as noisy as we had thought it might be. The beds are very comfortable with feather duvets and pillows and good quality linen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: undecidedLuton
Reviews.Content: On arrival my first impression of the hotel room was how quiet it was even though it was so near the main road. The rooms were bright and spacious and excellent facilities for self catering were provided. One of the best features of the hotel was the buffet breakfast, fresh fruit,cereals, muesli, assorted breads and an array of pastries. The transport links to the City and Bondi in particular are excellent. There are plenty fantastic restaurants within walking distance of the hotel and also a wonderful deli across the road with worldwide authentic fresh foods. Staff at the hotel are helpful and informative of places that might be of interest. I would recommend this hotel to couples,singles or business travellers but not to families as the bathroom I think, would be too small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Winnie134
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Quest Potts Point for a weekend and really enjoyed it. We chose the hotel because a good friend recommended it and we were very happy with the hotel. The room was really nice and clean and the receptionis that checked us in was very helpful. We wanted to have a nice dinner somewhere local and she gave us some great suggestions. We really liked this hotel and will recommend it to more friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, value for money”
Reviews.Author: jarobu
Reviews.Content: I had 22 people from around the world staying for 5 days. Many of rooms don't have great outlooks but they are well appointed, very clean and the staff went out of their way to assist the group in any way they could. The hotel is located near great restaurants, the railway station, bus stops and access to the Explorer Bus couldn't be closer. The participants, who came from 10 countries, were very positive about their experience at Quest Potts Point and if I were organising another group I wouldn't hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, convenient location, good value”
Reviews.Author: bak_10
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be perfect for all my needs. I travel to Sydney regularly for business and personally, this location is extremely convenient. Only minutes to the CBD and a better place than most to stay as its right on the doorstep of some of my favourite Sydney restaurants. The staff were pleasant and efficient which is a nice change from some other stuck up Sydney hotels. Put simply, great hotel. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel....right in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: Pierr0
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed at Quest during the Christmas holidays. We wanted a clean & comfortable hotel that wasn't too expensive. A friend of mine had recommended it to us & we weren't disappointment. The staff were friendly & the room was clean, comfortable & very modern. It was conveniently located & close to some great bars & clubs. Public transport was plentiful in the area. I'll definitely be back & will certainly recommend it to family & friends when they come to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WestSide78
Reviews.Content: I travel to Sydney quite a bit for work and stay in the typical corporate CBD hotels. Recently, my husband and I were looking for a getaway over the long weekend. We wanted to stay somewhere different, but still in a modern hotel, centrally located. We heard about Quest Potts Point and decided to give it a go. We were blown away with the experience. The whole package was spot on, great value for money, fantastically located, modern rooms and good service. Upon arrival, the staff were friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the area and were more than happy to recommend great restaurants/ bars and activities. The room was impressive - contemporary and stylish. I liked the fact that you could open the windows for fresh air (not many hotels offer this). Most importantly, the room was sparkling clean and we felt comfortable and were able to relax straight away. As far as things to do in the area go, they were plentiful, we spent the mornings walking down to Woolloomooloo and then down to the harbour. The days were spent shopping and eating at Macleay street (there were heaps of trendy local shops and cafes). I much prefer this location over the CBD due to the fact that its not the typical tourist destination. We will be back for sure and I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for good bang for your buck in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vibe, great location!”
Reviews.Author: smithy051
Reviews.Content: Loved our weekend in a very stylish mod room with nice touches and right in the middle of the action. Sems a good feel about the place with friendly staff working together. We found them very informative and helpful and lots of international travvellers there when we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “This one you should avoid”
Reviews.Author: foulaman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Quest Potts Point April 10-14, 2009. We were in a small but relatively pleasant "superior" room on the 4th floor for the first two nights. The air conditioner dripped water onto the carpet both nights (the staff attempted to fix it after we reported it the first morning after arrival). The bathroom was tiny and the shower leaked water over the floor. The hot water was spotty. After returning from a day's sightseeing on the second day we were informed by the front desk staff, without apology, that there had been an insect problem in the room next door and they had to fumigate our room. This probably explained the bites my wife had received overnight. The staff had entered our room, packed up our belongings, and moved them to a new room (number 122 on the first floor). When we noted that we would have to go up to retrieve the contents of the safe, we were told the staff had opened the safe and gave us two envelopes with the money, passports and other items we had left in the safe. What good is an in-room safe if the staff can open it? The second room was even smaller than the first, with a miniscule TV (don't believe their website indicating that each room has a 23 inch TV), no room for a bedside lamp on one side, and at most 15 cm between the bed and the wall. The windows looked out onto another apartment building so there was no privacy with the blinds up. When I asked what was the difference between a standard and superior room (for which we paid a higher rate) I was told at the front desk that superior rooms had two-burner cooktops. The website shows a picture of a superior room with a small table and two chairs. This was not what we received in return for the superior rate. This is the first time in decades of travel that we have experienced a hotel management that has actually downgraded our room as compensation for a problem caused by the hotel itself. If we had not prepaid the room we would have checked out immediately and gone to one of the hotels in the central business district (which incidentally are competitively priced compared to the Quest Potts Point). Also keep in mind the location. While we were there the Sydney media carried stories about increased police presence on King's Cross in anticipation of possible heightened gang activity. This is within one minute's walk of the hotel. Overall, very disappointing and among the worst hotel experiences we have had anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service Apartment for the location and price”
Reviews.Author: de_moivre007
Reviews.Content: First time in Sydney and stayed 3 nights in this wonderful service apartment. Although it is small, but it is very self sufficient. The distance from the nearest Kings Cross station is like a 2 min walk, although it looked further on the map. Highly recommended. It would have been perfect if Wi-fi was provided free of charge

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing; over-priced; pretentious hotel, arrogant unhelpful staff; avoid”
Reviews.Author: chvds
Reviews.Content: Tiny dark rooms during the day, with light pollution at night; most rooms have windows facing another building just 1m away, leaving almost no daylight coming in. When asking staff for another room upon arrival on higher floor, the staff at reception refused even to check to see if anything was available. When remarking about lack of daylight, staff became stroppy and said "but there are windows in your room". Upon arrival we're informed that over Easter weekend there's 'light service' only: bed will not be made up; no such info was given at time of booking. I find it astounding that this hotel is happy to take your money, but then at the very time of their peak season, when they're full, they are not willing or able to perform a normal service. Street noise at night from overspill of rowdy people on King's Cross main strip 20m away. Check-out time is an unbelievably early 10am. When asked for a one-hour late check-out, staff again became defensive and without checking if it was possible said no, tersely reminding us of hotel policy. The desk in the room is not suitable for working with computer as no power socket is installed nearby, so one has to sit on the bed to use laptop. No enclosed shower cubicle provided in bathroom, so water splashes all over bathroom floor. Term 'serviced apartment' is a misnomer. The only additional facility our room had was a microwave; The only good thing about this hotel that we didn't have to spend much time in it, since we spent most of our time with friends nearby in Elizabeth Bay, and only came back to sleep. Should we have had to spend a lot of our time at the hotel, it would have been very unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice but poor service”
Reviews.Author: stray1001
Reviews.Content: Hotel in seedy area, looks cosy but they are terribly short of staff and cannot answer any queries. Avoid unless you know Sydney very well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Poppageorgio
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, Interesting location, Can seem a bit seedy at times however i felt completely safe in night time walking around. However in the day time lots of weird individuals around the area mainly due to the red light district of kings cross and the surrounding suburbs which i was told by staff a lot of homeless people live as there are homeless centres around the area and drug rehabilition centres too. Staff were very friendly and the hotel it's self is very basic no frills. overall a nice stay..

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but in a seedy area”
Reviews.Author: pandrcollins
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it had been recommended on Trip Advisor. Arriving on a Sunday, we found that one of the rooms had not been properly cleaned, although the bedlinen etc had been changed. Apparently. cleaners do not work there on Sundays. The rooms were comfortable and one had its own courtyard, which was very pleasant. Breakfast was good and overall, it presented good value for money. The location was ok for us (4 adults travelling together) but I would not recommend it for families with young children as the Kings Cross area ia rather akin to London's Soho. It is however only a very short walk to the beautiful Botanic Gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Probably wouldn't go back”
Reviews.Author: PistolPete2009
Reviews.Content: The room was quite nice, with a big bed, full kitchenette and it was quiet. However, for the price, Quest need to up their game in a couple of areas. The air conditioning unit in my room started making a loud buzzing noise on the first night and it took them 3 days to fix it. They did supply a fan which was nice, but it didn't really cool what was a big room. Probably worth checking these things before guests arrive. Breakfast in the restaurant was limited too. There was nowhere to get water in the night and the tap only ran warm in my room. The night porter (available only by phone) was no help. The terrace, which other reviews have described as lovely, and which was right outside my room, was strewn with Pizza boxes and beer bottles every morning when I went past it. Not what I would call lovely. The local area, whilst vibrant, is in the middle of Sydney's equivalent of London's Soho. Lots of lapdancing clubs and a few ladies for hire on the streets too. I imagine for a young group looking for fun, this location would work. However, if you have a young family I would not recommend staying here. For the same price, incredibly, you can stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “nice spot, surrounding bit strange”
Reviews.Author: The_Lassnig_Family
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at Quest Potts Point. Our room was spacious regarding it's a city-hotel, bathroom is not too big but ok. Staff was very helpful, fixed our locked safe immediately. Very close to cityrail-station, walking distance to botanical gardens. Red light district right round the corner with some strange mates, but we never felt insecure or frightened. Although our windows were to the place in front of the hotel noise was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, perfect location and good size rooms and CLEAN!”
Reviews.Author: JCNR
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently at Quest Potts Point and have to say that this is our second time and now we know this is where we will be staying for all future business and leisure travels to Sydney. Service was prompt, breakfast offered a wide choice of healthy foods, rooms were a good size for a stay over a week and the location is perfect, between the harbour and Moore Park. I would recommend this hotel to all business and leisure stays. Most importantly the hotel was clean... what more can I cay! JCNR.

Reviews.Title: “Quest Potts Point...chic, friendly, relaxing botique hotel...just like Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: MarianHosman
Reviews.Content: Quest Potts Point surpassed all my expectations. It's unique architecture, room designs and environmental efforts were a welcome relief from the larger, corporate hotels of my past travels. The front desk staff was friendly, knowledgeable and always ready to assist. Managemeent obviously has taken pride in presenting, not only a chic addition to Sydney's atmosphere and culture, but also, in making a guest's stay worry-free and comfortable. Quest Potts Point is an easy walk to the beautiful botanical gardens, Sydney Harbor, trendy shops and scrumptous dining. Do yourself a favor and check-out this little gem in Ozzie land.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location for the money”
Reviews.Author: staceytann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Potts Point over the New Year holiday. We had a Petite Suite. It was a bit small for two people staying for a week. I had a hard time finding the room to unpack and store suitcases, but this was the only negative. The locatio is 1 block from the subway station (CityRail) on the Eastern line, which goes directly to Bondi Junction and everywhere else by transferring thru the Town Hall or Central stops. Very convenient. The redlight district is a little dirty, but we often walked down Darlinghurst to get to restaurants at night with no problem - very safe. You can completely avoid the street by getting on the subway on Victoria street. The room was very clean with a modern vibe to it. It has a kitchenette. We only made coffee with it. We bought some ground coffee - they have a plunger (French press) and they supplied the milk and sugar. We really like the rooftop terrace. We would sit and have a glass of wine and read in the afternoons before dinner. Staff was extremely helpful - they bought a train ticket for us online, and always had goods suggestions. We were allowed to check in early after arriving directly from the States that morning. One note: check your bill. We were overcharged a night prior to our arrival and didn't get the refund until we were checked in. We ended up paying the exchange fee on a charge that was their mistake - no cash refund. I still thinking the value of the place puts it on top for places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler75
Reviews.Content: The Quest Potts Point was everything it was advertised to be. The rooms were modern, clean and well-run. The staff was friendly and accommodating - they helped me get oriented when I arrived in Sydney, ordered me taxis when I needed them, and gave good recommendations for restaurants. Potts Point is centrally located in Sydney, which made it convenient to many of the sights I wanted to see. In terms of micro-location, I agree with some other posters who say that the hotel is too close to the nightlife district in King's Cross, which is a bit seedy in the view of a woman traveling alone. Still, the pros far outweigh the one con, and I would stay here again. For the price, it's hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Staff did try but service restrictions, location and layout of hotel terrible”
Reviews.Author: ST_ray_BJ
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by a colleague who did not know Sydney well. King's Cross is bustling and interesting, and it seemed safe to be out at night (because everything is open!) but it is still a red light district and far from many of the other sights. Families with young children may need to take this into account. The rooms are strangely designed -- the sinks are narrow so you always splash your feet when you wash your hands. None of our rooms had windows with natural light. It was, however, spotless and the staff very friendly. One major drawback, is that this appears more of a servce apartment than a hotel, and any arrivals (check-ins) / departures (check-outs) outside "normal" hours mean waking up the skeletal night-time staff. Email communication was also EXTREMELY poor, with multiple queries going unanswered (perhaps an overzealous spam program?). Overall, it is not a bad hotel, and staff did try to be helpful. However, I have stayed in other more reasonably priced (and better located) hotels in Sydney that have a lower rating on tripadvisor so I was definitely expecting something more.

Reviews.Title: “The place is great”
Reviews.Author: travalot64
Reviews.Content: Loved the cleannes of the rooms The staff were quite helpful with directions, information and special requests. Great and loved the roofdeck!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Andyyyyy
Reviews.Content: Here is my review Hope it helps Regarding the location. It's very close to anything you have to get to. The coffee / breakfast next door at Petrol is very very good.If you hang a left when you leave the hotel and walk down 4 or 5 blocks you can find some very hip neighbourhood cafes. For a really great breakfast go Uliveto on Bayswater ( 2 blocks away ) http://www.eatability.com.au/au/sydney/uliveto-cafe/map.htm great all day breakfast. As well, for a nice drink at night The Piano Bar was great. The amount of people at night in Kings Cross at first is a little intimidating but I quickly got used to it The Rooms I love the look of these rooms After living in boutique hotels why would I go back? The other type of standard hotel would bore me to tears. What puzzles me is the decor of the breakfast room when you first arrive. It does not suit the hotel at all and if it were as funky as the rooms it would probably be used way more often. The Staff Amazing. Friendly and really know what they are doing. -Andy

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice ...”
Reviews.Author: mutchAT
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this beautiful apartment hotel for a week and it was the perfect choice! The Quest is in walking distance to the city (going thru the botanic garden which is beautiful). It is surrounded by nice bars and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and obliging, it felt like staying at a friendâ€™s home! Because the wireless network connection was very good I was able to check my emails and upload new pictures directly from the exceptional nice rooftop with a great view to the skyline of the city. The apartment was very coolâ€¦ Sliding bath door made of frosted glass, mirror on the top of the comfortable bed and of course very nice paintings on the wall. I had a great time in Sydney not at least because of the very good accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ma57London
Reviews.Content: I canâ€™t believe this â€œhotelâ€� has such a good reviews. I donâ€™t really have high standards when it comes to hotels, but after reading all the trip advisor reviews I was looking forward to what I thought was going to be the best hotel of our three weeks holiday. It was the worst. What a disappointment. First of all, it is not a hotel, it is serviced apartments, and this means that the room is not cleaned daily. Secondly, the room was small, and the bathroom the smallest Iâ€™ve ever seen. It was so small that there was no space for a shower door, there was just a curtain and the shower was at the same level as the rest of the bathroom so after having a couple of showers the entire bathroom was full of water. If you take into account that they donâ€™t clean the rooms daily the mess in the second day was just awful. I wouldnâ€™t recommend this hotel at all

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, cool rooms, awesome roof deck”
Reviews.Author: drask
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if you have some work to do and are not in Sydney just for the sights or the beaches (although they're easily accessible, the train is just steps away). Friendly and helpful staff, clean, modern, quiet, safe. I'm a writer on deadlines, so needed to work by day, play by night. This place was ideal. Efficiency kitchen with fridge, stove and microwave let me eat my breakfast and lunch while working and save $$. Great restaurants and night life just outside the door. Walk to Woolamoloo and the Boy Charlton Pool for exercise or sip a glass of vino on the roof deck. I felt like a local who was well looked after by the staff. My new home away from home in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Inner-City Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: djsars
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Sydney in a large group and booked the Quest Potts Point. When I arrived, it offered so much more than being in close proximity to bars, restaurants, public transport and the centre of Sydney. The hotel was the perfect complement to our trip; the room was extremely comfortable, spacious, clean and user-friendly and the staff were very attentive and welcoming. I will now only stay at this hotel when travelling to Sydney and would definitely recommend it to anyone who is looking for an inexpensive yet trendy boutique hotel in the hub of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Charming place to stay while visiting Sydney”
Reviews.Author: exzile
Reviews.Content: a charming little hotel with extremely helpful staff. An art deco style gone slightly wrong which made it seem a little like an upmarket brothel....to be honest I only came up with this as the neighbourhood that the hotel is in does have a seedy side to it. Being from Holland it was all rather tame but i can imagine that a family from the US with kids may have other views about this. Nevertheless i would have absolutely no qualms advising anyone to stay here. Everything is within walking distance and we had a fantastic 2 days here.

Reviews.Title: “Great contemporary boutique hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sglpdl
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with kitchenettes in room. Clean and quiet. Within a stones throw of metro station and many restaurants. Although on the edge of a the red light district and a notorious area for habitual drug users we walked through the area at night several times with our toddler without any problems. Staff at hotel were great and accomodating and especially friendly to our little one. We would definitely consider this property again upon our return to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Funky Feelgood Place in Sydney!!!”
Reviews.Author: BarneyBearMelbourne
Reviews.Content: What a charming gem of a place to stay. The location is fabulous, with great restaurants & bars right at your feet. We especially loved relaxing on the roof top terrace, with a lovely view of Syndey in front of you!! It was quiet and peaceful. What a funky, feel good place to stay!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: primerstar6
Reviews.Content: We loved our 2 nights at this hotel! Great location, set amid everything while still situated in a quiet place. The room was cozy but beautifully appointed and really made our stay in Sydney special and unique. This may be the best hotel I've stayed in. ..and I've stayed in a lot! The staff was friendly, the room had gorgeous design and decor, the rooftop terrace was nice.. Not much could have improved the stay we had here (maybe free wifi ;)

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, style and fabulous service in trendy and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Sally095
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in easy walking distance of Sydney's main attractions, including Circular Quay, where all the ferries leave for trips across the harbour. It is only two minutes walk to the local train station. Potts Point has an old world charm, with quiet, leafy streets and attractive buildings with a sense of history. The interior of the hotel is modern, with a light, bright, welcoming feel. The staff are professional, friendly and very helpful.
