We stayed in the Twin Executive Suite which was very spacious, with two queen sized beds, complete with their own televisions; a roomy and clean ensuite bathroom with two basins; a kitchenette with gas cook-top, fridge and microwave; and a convenient dining area. There are also two day beds in the room. It has a private, clean and restful feel. Breakfast in the dining room is lovely, with lots of choice: fresh fruit salad, bircher muesli, a range of other cereals, fresh muffins, croissants, ham and cheese, toast etc. as well as good expresso coffee, and a range of herbal teas. The staff managed to attend to our every need whilst remaining totally unobtrusive. There is a private, secluded, sunny roof top area which is a peaceful place to sit and read, or to have a quiet drink or meal. In the evenings there is cut price drinks in the bar downstairs. We couldn't fault the experience of staying at Quest Pott Point.

Reviews.Title: “The guys at potts point quest made our weekend away”
Reviews.Author: StepSouthYarra
Reviews.Content: Not being familiar with Sydney we booked this hotel as friends had recommended it. The location was so easy to get around (we were in Sydney for the City to Surf run) and walked nearly everywhere all weekend. The staff were available and really helpful, the room we stayed in was gorgeous and was fully self contained which saved us eating out all the time. Really modern and really friendly, definately going to stay there when next in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive in so many ways...”
Reviews.Author: Shunny2
Reviews.Content: The location of this place is just ideal, it's right in the heart of the action! I really liked the style of the rooms too. The beds were comfy, we had a kitcenette and two bathrooms which was a real bonus! The staff were super friendly which made us feel really welcome and they told us about the best places to visit and made sure that we didn't get lost! The rooftop garden was also really lovely with awesome views of the city. It was really nice to sit back there at dusk and take it all in.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: vegastti
Reviews.Content: We came to stay for holidays with my friends. Rooms new and clean with great kitchenette Location also very good in quite area.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely short stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SimoneDavis
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4. Two children 9 & 11 and 2 adults) decided to take up an cheap flight offer with Jetsar and stayed at Quest Potts Point for a Four Day Stay. Great Hotel. Freindly and helpful staff, giving us ideas on daytrips and restuarant, which were all kid freindly. A fifteen minute senic walk to the Harbour through the Botanical Gardens and access to the ferries. Manly was was of our highlights together with a fabulous slice of the most delicious flourless chocolate cake which is a must when you visit Potts Point at cafe Yellow. Any how, wasn't sure on the location and it turned out to be a great family weekend away. I would definatley recommend Quest Potts Point

Reviews.Title: “Charming Place with great service”
Reviews.Author: HolidayLover36
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and i were in sydney for a work meeting, it was the first time we stayed at Quest Potts Point as we usually stay at another hotel in the city. I was abit courious as to how the Hotel would be like as its located in the kings cross area, however to my surprise the hotel is gorgeous and well maintained. I stayed in the Deluxe studio rooms which are just opened planned rooms with a queen bed and unlike a normal hotel room they have a kitchenette in the rooms aswell.Although i didnt use the kitchenette i can see the advantage in having it for those people that are staying for longer then 1 night. The staff were really friendly when we were looking for a place to have dinner, i would recommend Hugos- as it had great pizza and cocktails and is ony a short walk away from the hotel. I think the only down side to the hotel is the breakfast buffet,which is located just off the reception area. The look of the buffet is abit of a let down in comparison to the cute decor in the room. Its nothing fancy just the basics which is ok however would be great if they had some better fresh fruit. Overall great place, service was good all the staff were friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel in good location - some little issues”
Reviews.Author: Leer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my sister and overall we both loved it. We negotiated a good deal directly with the hotel and had one of the twin suits (as we needed 2 beds). The hotel was extremely quiet and we only saw another guest on the day we departed. First, the positives: It looks gorgeous - we loved the design, colour scheme, size of rooms, kitchenette etc. Location - so many great restaurants nearby - Fratelli Fresh, Fratelli Paradiso, Lotus, etc Staff very friendly but slightly miss the mark - see below. View of the city from our room Free newspaper Lovely rooftop terrace Not so positives (wouldn't really call then Negatives): Restaurant has closed Bar only open Thurs to Sunday (we stayed Mon - Wed) No mini bar Breakfast room looked gorgeous but the breakfast looked very ordinary (boxed cereal etc) so we ate elsewhere (suggest Paradiso or Petrol) Service could be improved eg when my sister rang front desk to ask about hairdressers the girl said she would call us back with names & numbers. We waited over half an hour and had to call her back - to find that she had not done it. With a hotel this quiet this is not really acceptable. We also had a couple of globes that needed changing - they did change the main one over the bed but not the one in the lamp as asked. When I booked I explained it was a "special" birthday for my sister. Only one of the staff (lovely guy) even made a comment about this. Finally, the kitchen could have had a little more attention. The oven door was not very clean and the kitchen bench did have some dried food on it. I also found a used lip gloss on the floor near the bed. Whilst there were some issues regarding the service levels, overall it was a lovely. Despite my comments above the staff were all very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: Hipp01
Reviews.Content: We came to Sydney for a sporting event and stayed here for three nights. We were a bit worried about the hotel being so close to Kings Cross, but ended up being very happy with our choice.The hotel is very central,easy to find and close to some great restaurants, supermarkets and public transport.Our room had a great view of the city and was very spacious and comfortable.The staff were friendly and very helpful when answering questions and giving directions.( The valet parking was a bonus).We looked forward to coming back to the hotel each night after a long day out!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: CubaSue
Reviews.Content: Okay, they call it Potts Point when it's really the Cross - but you couldn't really ask for a better location - just a few minutes from the train station, walking distance to Oxford St and all the other local pleasures. You might just want to watch that back street at night! And the hotel was wonderful. We had three nights in a room on the top floor - with kitchen and private terrace. What a cool surprise to be able to see the Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House from our room. The staff were friendly, helpful and well-informed - and like most Sydneysiders, very welcoming of Kiwi visitors. My only gripe about the room - the bathroom was tiny!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in interesting area!!”
Reviews.Author: dcleary007
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights at the Quest PP. Whilst the hotel initially is difficult to find, its within 200 metres of the exit from Kings Cross train so is ideally located. Buses also run near to the hotel. Check in was smooth and the room was clean and inviting. We were on the top (4th) floor, which was excellent as outside our room was access to the balcony area with good views over Sydney. Great for a late night drink. The kitchen area was small but sufficient for our needs (early morning drinks, snacks etc). All appliances worked and everything kept spotless. Outside the hotel is interesting (to say the least!). The bright lights of Kings Cross made for some interesting evening walk backs, with sex workers and drinkers rubbing shoulders. However we always felt safe. Woomooloomoo is walkable and there are plenty of bars and restaurants in the vicinity. We also made good use of the on site launderet. In summary I would strongly recommend the Quest and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - had a great time”
Reviews.Author: rockyspagedi
Reviews.Content: The Quest is located very good near Kings Cross, within 20 min or less you can reach the Opera House, Financial District, Ferry terminal or Oxford street by foot. Kings Cross offers a Mix of everything you can see in Sydney. It's a great location for a stay. Stayed there for 7 nights. It is a petite nice little boutique hotel which has it's own charm and a very stylish design. My room (240) was a very nice appartment room with kitchen, big bed, safe and TV. The bathroom had a big shower, which is always important for me and everything else you need and would request from a room. The roof terrace offers an amazing view over the skyline of Sydney and you can hang out there perfectly. The personnel is very friendly and courteous, they are fast on requests make you having a good time and a pleasant stay. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Kings Cross”
Reviews.Author: FluffPuff
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a central location to base yourself in Sydney, this is a good place to start. The staff are friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and the location close to bars / restaurants / public transport. But if the Quest Potts Point describes your room as "petite" they aren't kidding! I would have preferred a larger bed and the room was certainly compact but otherwise more than adequate. The location is possibly better described as Kings Cross. You are right on Darlinghurst Road and to be honest there are some pretty seedy people wandering around, especially at night. I wouldn't recommend staying here to single female travellers or anyone who is offended by strip clubs, homeless people or street brawls. But if you'd like a taste of Sydney's underbelly, give it a go.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterMatt
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel Experience! Very particular hotel with everything you could ask for & more!Service is a strongpoint all around, it was faultless. Hotel is outstanding because of its modern design and fabulous location. It is in the party centre of Sydney but still very quiet. The very nice staff even managed for us a valet parking service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming Hotel in great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: marlow71
Reviews.Content: Stayed their with a friend (two different rooms) last december for 7 nights and had a wonderful time there. Although I am travelling a lot I have seldomly stayed over at such a great place: The rooms are exptremey chic and modern, very stylish, but yet very cosy; staff is always friendly and helfpful, location is great: it's located in a very quiet little street (so absolutely no noise at night) which surprisingly lays in the middle of Kings Cross, with all its restaurants, clubs, shops and whatever you feel up to. City Center and harbour are just a fifteen minute walk away. And last but not least: it's got a great price compared with other hotels in the same category.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, small hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: contractreports
Reviews.Content: I live locally and needed to be out of my apartment for a couple of nights. I tried several hotels around Sydney and only this one in my own neighbourhood. I wish I had come here first. It was the least expensive and by far the most stylish with the largest rooms and definitely the best value for money. I shall put all my guests in here and only wish they had a bar on their delightful roof deck. Close to transport but in heart of both chic (Potts Point) and seedy (Kings Cross)Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier.”
Reviews.Author: joescapicchio25
Reviews.Content: This elegantly appointed, sheek boutique hotel is centrally located, has a friendly and courteous staff, and a sweet, stlyish roofdeck overlooking Potts Point, Hyde Park, the CBD and seasonally, Sydney Harbour. Great sunset views as well. The uber-modern rooms appeared brand new and are decorated with clean lines, mirrored glass and modern, glass-walled washrooms, but with a cozy, comfy bed. The deluxe studios come equipped with ipod docks, large wardrobe and full kitchenettes with mirrored backsplash. I actually stayed in two separate rooms and both exceeded expectations in amenities, cleanliness and comfort. The smaller, but impressive lobby, with glass walls and marble floors, has an upscale cafe and small bar. The staff were quite helpful with directions, information and special requests. Great value and loved the roofdeck!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: TimmyJones
Reviews.Content: Quest Potts Point is so great- I've struggled to find the perfect place to stay in Sydney but for now, this is it. The rooms are great- all that you could need; trendy, clean, comfy and boutique. The location is so convenient for work and for touring, the staff were really friendly and helpful, management were great and I just felt like I'd found the perfect base - cloe toe everything yet quiet and calm. I've recommended my boss book all our staff in here cos we work in Syd often.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Farrugia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Quest Potts Point a few months ago. My husband and I were amazed at the location of the place. So accesable to all the restuarants and cocktail bars on famous Macleay street. Only a few minutes from the city and right in the heart of Sydney's Eastern suburbs. We loved it. The hotel was great too. Fantastic, modern rooms and a great deck upstairs to chill out. It was very comfortable and clean and the service was excellent. Very affordable too we thought. Definitely check this out iwhen you are in Sydney next.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTraveller49
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be the prefect location for my trip to Sydney, close to transport which made it easy to get in and out of the CBD. Stayed 7 nights and found the roon to very clean and hotel staff extremely friendly. Great dining options close by , make sure you check out the Sugarmill pub located opposite Quest.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bnbev
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at QPP for about a week in February. We had a great stay. The room had everything we could have asked for. We especially liked the mini kitchen which we stocked with snack foods and drinks from a nearby grocery store. The hotel staff was always very friendly and accommodating. Our room was always pristinely clean when we returned each day. The decor was quite fun and modern. The location makes it convenient to get to different places in the city and finding a cab was always quite easy. If you don't take advantage of breakfast at QPP, try out breakfast next door at Petrol. While Kings Cross is just a short walk away, we felt very safe and never had any issue with noise while we were there. Take the time to check out the roof deck which has an incredible view!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Room, Accommodating Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hozzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Quest over the Mardi Gras weekend. The hotel was almost full, but the service was excellent even on Sunday when the staff was at a minimum. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. The cleaning staff was invisible. Quest is located near the busy Kings Cross section, but the room was quiet as a church. There is a small kitchenette in the room with a two-burner gas cook-top, a microwave and a small refrigerator. There is also a small supply of pots, pans and utensils. I didnâ€™t cook, but I used the frig and microwave so I could control my calorie intake which is difficult when on vacation. The continental breakfast is limited but adequate. The best thing was the availability of filtered coffee. Iâ€™m from the USA, and I canâ€™t get used to espresso and latte. I got to taking a cup up to the roof-top deck in the morning. The only snag I found was that the card to open the lock to my room kept failing. I got around that by having the front desk reprogram it each time I came in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bnbev
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at, what is now, Quest Potts Point while we were in Sydney. We had a wonderful stay and loved the hotel. The room was clean and very poshly decorated and the servfice was great. The location, as noted in previous posts, is just a block away from Kings Cross, but the area is so populated, even late into the night/early into the morning, we never felt unsafe. The hotel serves breakfast which we did not try while we were there. Our first day we visited Petrol next door and liked it so much we kep returning. If you feel like brining snacks/food back to your room, it is equiped with a mini kitchen and there is a grocery store just under the big Coke sign in Kings Cross (just about 2 blocks away). The hotel location made it really easy to catch a cab or walk downtown (about 20 minutes). Be sure to check out the great reef deck, which offers an awesome view of downtown! The only thing I would caution on is to ask for extra towels because the curtain does not do a great job to keeping water from the shower off of the bathroom floor. Other than that, we have absolutely no complains about Questt Potts Point and would recommend it to anyone looking for a great place to stay in Syndey.

Reviews.Title: “The Storrier - What a great boutique hotel !”
Reviews.Author: deathracer
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip in Australia and arranged a stop-over in Sydney to visit my brother, sister-in law and my daughter, who was travelling in Asia. My brother lives in Potts point and this is the hotel he setup for us. We got an Executive Twin Suite because it had 2 queen beds. The location is excellent. Other reviewers have commented about the location being dodgy because it's adjacent to a red light disctrict. We did not find this to be true for us, as whenever we exited the hotel, we headed left/left, which took us immediately to a trendy neighbourhood with neat inexpensive restaurants and backpacker hostels. The staff was very friendly. Secure card key access is required after hours. Our room I was really pleased to see that one of the Queen beds was in an alcove with a large floor to ceiling retractable curtain, so my daughter could close this off and it seemed like she had her own small room. The Good - Great staff (especially Rebecca) - Mini kitchen (microwave, fridge, dishes, sink) - 2 full bathrooms with stand-up showers - 2 Flat screen TVs (one per bed) - Clock radio with iPod dock - Wired internet (seemed fast) & moderately priced - Seemed very sound-proof - Beds very comfortable - Ventilation very good - Very clean and seems well cared for - Water temperature and pressure excellent - Room was very clean, modern and well decorated To Improve: - The shower needs a better seperator so that water doesn't splash on the bathroom floor Conclusion: It was hard to find anything I didn't like about the Storrier (now Quest). The whole vibe of this place feels right. TIP: If you lik to walk or jog, just minutes from the Storrier is a large flight of stairs (on one of the streets), which take you right down to the water front. We found this to be a great early morning jog or walk. If you want to do a nice "out and back" jog, you can easily get right to the Sydney Opera house and back, mostly on walking paths and it's 8KM.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value; great ambience and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix2Sydney
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the management of this hotel has been taken over by Quest Apartments (www.questpottspoint.com.au). So far as I can tell, however, nothing has been changed in the excellent decor, and customer service. I agree that the rooms are quite small, but the really clever use of space, colour, and mirrors totally compensates. For a hotel that was refurbished about 2 years ago, it is still in 'as new' condition and a great deal better than many 4 or even 5 star properties. The addition of comprehensive cooking facilities just adds to the appeal, though with so many of Sydney's best restaurants just around the corner, one hardly needs to bother. But the offering of vacuum packed ground coffee to feed the coffee press in the room was extremely welcome on waking up. If you want to enjoy a takeaway, there is a great rooftop terrace with a magnificent view of the city. Comments about noise will depend on which room you get. The more expensive ones with picture windows do look out on the street and could be noisy at weekends. Mine was a superior studio facing a side alley - and therefore a wall some 10 feet away, but the compensation was total silence at night. The bed is very comfortable, the bathroom quite sharp and practical, and the presence of limited cable to supplement the free TV channels is a plus as is the availability of broadband. The comments about the safety of the area will depend on what you find challenging. Yes, Kings Cross is the primary nightlife area, so there may be rowdy people, and there are sex shops, but to suggest it is basically unsafe is entirely incorrect. It is so busy and well-policed that you are more likely to be robbed in the Sydney city centre which tends to die after working hours. Also it must be said that if you turn the other way down Macleay Street, you will be in an area which has become very gentrified over the past few years and offers some of Sydneys best cafes, restaurants, and shopping. If it is entertainment you want, then the other direction leads to the best nightclubs. Great value at A$145 per night (approx US$100). I will undoubtedly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable style at the Storrier”
Reviews.Author: PT1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Storrier on Nov 22-23, 2008. We booked directly with the hotel for a "petite studio" for 140 AUS/ 98 US per night, and were very happy with our decision. We took the Skybus from the airport, which was great because it dropped us right in front of the hotel, but the place is really close to the King's Cross subway station but a little tricky to find, especially if you are jetlagged! The room was tiny but well appointed and pristine. Although it was so small, it felt luxurious anyway because they really got it right with the details. The bed was comfy and the bathroom very clean. There's a minibar plus a microwave and plates, glassses, and cutlery, and a small table, so if you want, you can dine in. I was pleasantly surprised with the kitchen stuff and the other amenities, which included Molton Brown bath products. There's also a large Storrier print (duh) on the wall and a matching wine bottle. The staff was friendly and helpful too ( especially one desk clerk who printed off directions for us). Points off for the shower (there's no door or separator, just a curtain so things get messy) and the bathroom is really really small. It can get pretty noisy at night and in the early morning, but it was charming to hear birds (as well as trucks) at 8 AM. Unfortunately, we didn't get to see the roofdeck because it was booked for a private function one night and it was rainy the next night. They have a restaurant, The Red Belly, but we ended up eating at a great casual Japanese restaurant across the street from King's Cross station. The location has its pros and cons - it's a young, cool neighborhood with loads of bars and restaurants and really lively on Saturday night (the hotel is right by a dance club). It's about 20 minutes' walking distance from the harbor, if you don't get lost, and right by the subway, which takes you everywhere. Problem is, the subway isn't as frequent as other big cities, so it can take up to 45 minutes to an hour to get to the Rocks or the Circular Quay if you are unlucky. We didn't mind it so much, but if you're keen in being close to "the sights," the Storrier may not be for you. We were extremely satisfied with it, though - they used every inch of space wisely and include everything you need in the room. What else can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy alley”
Reviews.Author: aussie_h
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Storrier for 4 nights in October. There are good and bad points about the hotel. The good: the hotel itself is very nice. The rooms were a little small, nice and clean. The interior decor is very funky. There are heaps of restaurants, bars and nightlife nearby. The Kings Cross subway station is only a minute walk away. The bad: To get to the hotel you have to walk either along an alley or a past a dodgy street area. It may be called Potts Point, but the other side of the street is Kings Cross. It didn't feel very safe walking to the hotel late at night. The Holiday Inn Potts Point is about 50m away, but it's a very important 50m. It felt a lot safer walking to the Holiday Inn, we would walk to the Holiday Inn and the catch a taxi for the last 50m to the hotel door.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing but not terrible”
Reviews.Author: ashgirlMelbourne
Reviews.Content: WE stayed three nights in a Petite Studio at $140 a night, which was a reasonable price comparatively. The room was very small, which we expected, and stylishly furnished. We found the staff to be very efficient and friendly. On the down side, the worst thing about the hotel was the area. Not being from Sydney, we didn't realise Potts Point (or Kings Cross) is as bad as it really is. The hotel is smack in the middle of the red light district and, although we like some urban grunge, the drug activity is scary and right in your face. We didn't feel safe walking around after dark. The second major complaint we had was the shower. It's hard to believe a hotel could have such a poor hot water system. In the end, I only used the hot tap for showering and the temperature alternated between hot and freezing cold. My partner didn't have any luck either. There were a few other disappointments worth mentioning. 1) There was a black pillow on our bed which was filthy dirty. I put it aside so it could be changed with the other linen but the next day it appeared again on our bed- just as dirty. 2) Our room was on the ground floor and quite noisy. We got woken up, not just by outside noise, but noise from the lobby and corridor (like people vacuuming outside our door early in the morning). All of that said, our stay was okay and not terrible. THe price was quite reasonable compared to others we looked at. We did look at moving hotel but there was no vacancy where we wanted, so in the end we decided it was easier to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ratchet7112
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Sydney at The Storrier and found it to be one of the best Hotels we've stayed at. We live in a regional area and are known for our friendliness so when staying at the Storrier we found it was like staying at a Hotel at home. Im jealous though, the rooms were better than my own bedroom. Staff were great and very helpful especially allowing us to leavew our car earlier than check-in time so we could relax and see the sites of the city without woorying about the car. Great access to buses, taxis, trains and walking distance to shops and restaurants. Will definetly recommend it and would love to stay again. Thankyou very muchly!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: the_artist40
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time at the Storrier! -Great location, close to great coffee (Fratelli's-yum!) walking distance to all my favourite Sydney things; Oxford Street and Ariel bookshop, the Gallery of NSW, the Botanic Gardens and the Darlo for a drink. The Hotel is well appointed, the beds are comfy and the staff are warm,friendly and professional with out being overcooked. We stayed in an executive studio, and it was compact but well designed with a perfect little kitchen. Tucked away off the main street it was surprisingly very quiet for such a busy area. Definitely going back to The Storrier.

Reviews.Title: “Great..., if you dont want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: global_nomad_pacific
Reviews.Content: The good things about this hotel are that the staff are really friendly and willing to help. The hotel is within walking distance of down town Sydney and just around the corner from the train station. Potts Point/Darlinghuurst also have a lot of good restaurants within walking distance. Bad things about the hotel The location is a couple of streets too close to Kings Cross so it is really noisy on the weekend. The rooms are very small and expensive for Sydney. The hotel is poorly designed - we could hear the people in the rooms next door everytime they opened and closed their doors - all day and all night. The bathrooms are tiny and completely impracticle - they are frosted glass so if you use the bathroom in the middle of the night not only will your partner hear everything you do in the bathroom but the bedroom is illuminated by the bathroom lights. Stay here if you are going to Sydney by yourself mid week - or if you plan to be partying all weekend and dont need to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “watch out for hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: peleer
Reviews.Content: I found what I thought was a great deal on this hotel and booked with them directly. They were having problems with their reservation system on line, but I was able to email the reservations desk and make the reservation. I had read so many good reviews about the hotel that I was really looking forward to my visit. I actually liked the location as it is close to many other hotels and restaurants and the Potts Point area is lovely and Kings Cross very interesting. My biggest problem was that the website indicated the rooms 'come with high speed internet access'. I discovered that the rooms have access available but the cost was $10/hour, $20 for 4 hours or $30/day. I did complain to the front desk and they said that they were aware that the website said this but that the internet was provided by an outside server and they had no control over the cost. The cost was added to my bill through the hotel, so I wondered about this. I wrote an email to the hotel while I was there reiterating my objection and did not receive a response. This really coloured my impression of the hotel. I didn't mind so much that the room was very tiny as it was in the back of the hotel and pretty quiet, or that 2 lightbulbs were burned out, or even that the sink was leaking all over the floor, as these issues were addressed immediately. I found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful, in all respects, except for the internet issue. Most hotels do seem to include this free of charge, and I wouldn't have objected if the website did not suggest that it was free. As long as you are prepared for the extra cost and can get a good deal, this is a pretty fair place to stay I reckon, but there are many other hotels in the same area where internet access is free.

Reviews.Title: “Inner city oasis - Charm and Cheer”
Reviews.Author: 40ishcouple
Reviews.Content: Sydney has been crying out for some stylish new Boutique hotels for quite some time and after reading about several new offerings we were thrilled to find that this hotel was also themed around one of our favourite artists, Tim Storrier. The location may seem a little strange, down an alley metres from 'The Strip' in Kings Cross, although it is technically in Potts Point - just. In saying that it was surprisingly quiet - and we had a front room - and so very handy that night when we found ourselves surrounded by some of Sydney's best restaurants and Bars on nearby Victoria Street. 'Jimmy Liks' is probably offering some of the best Asian/Fusion food in the country - but thats another story for another time. As a Designer I found a lot of thought has gone into the completion of this hotel. Being such an old building, with small spaces ( no doubt heritage protected) it would have been quiet a challenge to work within these confines and they have done a remarkable job. The rooms are, in fact, very small but the clever use of light, mirror and colour gives a sense of space and a touch of glamour. The bathroom is a bit tight but really considering the very reasonable tariff who would complain ? The service was faultless with all staff falling over themselves to help us, even at 3 in the morning when we found our way home from dinner. We will definately return and look forward to the next offerings ( The Whiteley and The Olsen) from this savvy Hotel group.

Reviews.Title: “7th Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Dazar
Reviews.Content: Oh my god. What a slice of heaven in the middle of the cross. The hotel is beautiful, art deco building with fabulous good sized rooms all new amenities and brand new divine soft beds. There is a fabulous rooftop terrace with a great view perfect for a bottle of wine on a clear night. It was altogether perfect. We ended up there again after a horrible experience at The Kirketon nearby. We arrived and the staff remembered us and even the details of our trip. They upgraded our room and booked us into dinner at the restaurant. The food was wonderful as was the service. Another amazing night at this new star of the Sydney scene. 1 point if staying on a Thurs - Sun night would maybe suggest a room away from the front of the hotel which can be a little noisy in the early hours.

HotelInfo.Name: Quest Potts Point
HotelInfo.Address: 15 Springfield Avenue, Sydney, New South Wales 2011, Australia
